title: Pentagram: 166 Perry Street
content:
It seems Pentagram’s Michael Beirut [thinks Peter Bilak designed Scala Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015024949/http:/blog.pentagram.com/2007/08/new-work-166-perry-1.php). I think he means [Fedra Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015024949/http:/www.typotheque.com/site/fonts.php?id=1). Am I wrong?

To quote: <cite>The 166 logo is based on a modified version of Peter Bilak’s beautiful typeface Scala Sans.</cite>
author: Conor

comments.content: Indeed. I just let him know.

Great.

All Peter needs now is to sell 10,000 licences for [Fedra Sans Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015024949/http:/www.typotheque.com/fonts/fedra_sans/) and he can bag that [€8m penthouse apartment](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015024949/http:/www.166perryst.com/).

;^)

Scala was Marten Majoor, right?

--  
Mike
